activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee Serrano

records.addlTxt: 03:42 PM  Defendant Christopher Lee Serrano appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Christopher Lee Serrano.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White and intern Verity Altenberger   appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $1000.00 signature bond set with conditions.

Absolute Sobriety.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only.  Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
